__e: All the things you used to do for each other, the little stuff... one day, you start forgetting to do those things, and you think, "It doesn't matter."
You know, they were raising hell, and we figure we could raise hell because we had something to raise hell against.
Looks like you were doing a little bit more than that.
- I think they uh... took it in turns.
I mean, every, uh... every bad thing that had ever happened to me, every mistake I had ever made was running in my head on a loop.
Looks like the lady and her friend were having a party.
The boys there weren't my type.
I think maybe this challenge will be they'll ask questions about each person-- maybe how old they were, what they do for a living-- which I don't know and I don't care.
We shouldn't feel bad as father was doing his job there.. ..and they were doing theirs.
My brother and his friends used to... used to do it all the time.
[Laughs] You didn't used to do this before. And now it's kind of all the time.
I wanted to kill people who did this to my mother.
No matter if they were in his class, on his team, or just needed someone to talk to,
If they were part of something and you're tied up in it...
They were part of a life that suddenly had never happened.
I got to meet all these people when I went to his funeral who had been involved in his life for the last three or four years.
The stuff you're talking about means knocking on some doors that were a part of my life way before I had Peter.
You don't know them, but they were part of the previous operation and they know a lot.
And when I grew up, I never appreciated them for that because it was just part of everyday life.
If they were part of something and you're tied up in it...
They are not the unit of experience.
But only because I thought that they were doing the right thing.
Those are really Mama's best friends, and they were people that bridged family and work.
